maml:description.maml:para: Return details of users matching the given criteria.
The Get-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityConfiguredUser cmdlet retrieves details of users matching the given criteria.
When provided only groups are returned in the results.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to retrieve details for. This should match as it is displayed in the console.
When provided only groups are returned in the results.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The unique ID of the user to retrieve details for.
When provided only groups are returned in the results.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided only groups are returned in the results.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to retrieve details for. This should match as it is displayed in the console.
The unique ID of the user to retrieve details for.
$false if an error occurs
Array of user rows as returned by the Web Services API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns all users/groups configured in the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns only the groups that are configured in the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns the details for the user named "TEST\testuser" that is configured in the AppSense Management Server.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves details about the configured security roles.
The Get-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityRole cmdlet retrieves details about the configured security roles.
The type of role to return details for.
When provided the results are returned as a dataset.
When provided the permissions will also be returned within the dataset.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The type of role to return details for.
The name of the role to retrieve details for.
When provided the results are returned as a dataset.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The unique ID of the role to retrieve details for.
When provided the results are returned as a dataset.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The type of role to return details for.
When provided the results are returned as a dataset.
When provided the permissions will also be returned within the dataset.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the role to retrieve details for.
The unique ID of the role to retrieve details for.
$false if an error occurs
Array of SecurityRolesRows as described by the Web Services API
SecurityRolesDataSet as described by the Web Services API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns both object and server security roles from the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns a dataset of both object and server security roles from the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns only the object security roles from the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns the server security role with the name "Modifier" from the AppSense Management Server.
This example returns the details for the security role with the specified unique ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes matching users from the configured users in the AppSense Management Server.
The Remove-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityConfiguredUser cmdlet deletes matching users from the configured users in the AppSense Management Server.
The name of the user to be deleted.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching user.
The unique ID of the user to be deleted.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching user.
The name of the user to be deleted.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching user.
The unique ID of the user to be deleted.
Returns $true if the users have been successfully deleted and $false if an error occurred.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes the "TEST\testuser" from the configured users in the AppSense Management Server.
Deletes the "TEST\testuser" from the configured users in the AppSense Management Server prompting for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes the matching security roles.
The Remove-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityRole cmdlet deletes the matching security roles from the AppSense Management Server.
The name of the security role to be deleted.
The type of the security role that is to be deleted.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching security role.
The unique ID of the security role to delete.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching security role.
The name of the security role to be deleted.
The type of the security role that is to be deleted.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to delete the matching security role.
The unique ID of the security role to delete.
Returns $true if the security roles have been successfully deleted and $false if an error occurred.

maml:alert.maml:para: Currently security roles that have been flagged as read only cannot currently be deleted.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example deletes the security role with the specified unique ID.
This example will delete the server security role called "TestRole" and will prompt the user for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates the given user in the AppSense Management Server.
The Set-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityConfiguredUser cmdlet creates the given user in the AppSense Management Server.
The username to create.
An array of the roles that the user should be a member of. The role names should match those that are configured already in the AppSense Management Server.
When provided denotes that the user should be created as a group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to create.
An array of the roles that the user should be a member of. The role names should match those that are configured already in the AppSense Management Server.
The server to use to query Active Directory.
An object containing the credentials to be used to query Active Directory.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to create.
An array of the roles that the user should be a member of. The role names should match those that are configured already in the AppSense Management Server.
The server to use to query Active Directory.
When provided the current user will be used to look up objects in Active Directory.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to create.
An array of the roles that the user should be a member of. The role names should match those that are configured already in the AppSense Management Server.
When provided denotes that the user should be created as a group.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The server to use to query Active Directory.
An object containing the credentials to be used to query Active Directory.
When provided the current user will be used to look up objects in Active Directory.
$false if an error occurred
The unique of the user ID that was created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will create the "TEST\testuser" in the AppSense Management Server. It uses the current user account and the NTAccount class to lookup the user details. No specific server roles are applied.

This example will create the "TEST\testuser" in the AppSense Management Server. It uses the current user account and the NTAccount class to lookup the user details. The user will be added to the Modifier and Viewer server roles.

This example will create the "TEST\testuser" in the AppSense Management Server. It uses the current user account to connect to Active Directory and lookup the user details. The user will be added to the Modifier and Viewer server roles.

This example will create the "TEST\testuser" in the AppSense Management Server. It prompts for a user account to connect to Active Directory and lookup the user details. The user will be added to the Modifier and Viewer server roles.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates a security role.
The Set-AppSenseManagementServerSecurityServerRole cmdlet creates or updates the given security role.
The name of the security to create/update.
An array of the server permissions for the server security role.
The description for the security role.
If supplied the security role will be flagged as read only.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to update the matching security role.
The name of the security to create/update.
An array of the object permissions for the object security role.
The description for the security role.
If supplied the security role will be flagged as read only.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to update the matching security role.
The name of the security to create/update.
The new name for the security role.
The new description for the security role.
The new object permissions for the object security role.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to update the matching security role.
The name of the security to create/update.
The new name for the security role.
The new description for the security role.
The new server permissions for the server security role.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to update the matching security role.
The name of the security to create/update.
An array of the server permissions for the server security role.
The description for the security role.
If supplied the security role will be flagged as read only.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Alerts what would have been carried out if this parameter was not supplied.
Prompts for confirmation before attempting to update the matching security role.
An array of the object permissions for the object security role.
The new name for the security role.
The new description for the security role.
The new object permissions for the object security role.
The new server permissions for the server security role.
$true if the matching security role was updated and $false if an error occurred
The unique ID of the security role that was created.

maml:alert.maml:para: Security role permissions are replaced with those specified when updating.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will attempt to create a new server security role called "Test Role". The new role will be assigned the AlertRuleAdministrator and AlertRuleCreator permissions.

This example will attempt to update the server security role called "TestRole" and give it the name "TestRole1" whilst ensuring permissions are set to AlertRuleAdministrator, AlertRuleCreator and AlertRuleModifier. The user will be prompted to accept the changes.
